name: KnowBe4 Academy Guide
title: KnowBe4 Academy Guide
body:
Note:Completing courses on the KnowBe4 Academy now counts as credit for the Security Awareness and Cultural Professional™ (SACP™) Continuing Professional Education (CPE) recertification. For more information, see the Security Awareness and Culture Professional (SACP) Certification Handbook from H Layer Credentialing.

The KnowBe4 Academy is an education platform where admins can learn how to successfully use and integrate KnowBe4’s products. In the academy, admins can follow various learning paths for different areas of KnowBe4, including KSAT, PhishER, and SecurityCoach. If you have any questions, concerns, or suggestions about the academy, reach out to academy@knowbe4.com.

Accessing the Academy

Before accessing the academy for the first time, ensure your first and last name is entered on the admin Profile page.

To access the academy from your KSAT console, click your email address in the top-right corner of the page. Then, click KnowBe4 Academy.

To access the academy from your PhishER console, click the user icon at the bottom of the navigation bar. Then, click KnowBe4 Academy.

Setting Up Your Profile

We recommend setting up your profile to customize your settings and preferences.

To set up your profile, follow the steps below:

  1. Log in to the KnowBe4 Academy.
  2. Click the profile picture icon in the top-right corner of the page, then click Settings.

  3. You’ll be taken to the User Settings page.
  4. On the Profile subtab, you can edit your profile picture, personal details, and more.
  5. When you’re finished editing information on this subtab, click Save.

Navigating the Academy

You can navigate through the academy to see our courses for our different products. For more information, see the subsections below.

Home

On the Home page, you can view our introductory courses, such as KnowBe4 101 and Security Awareness Training.

From this page, you can also view our Knowledge Base, connect on the KnowBe4 Community, or go to KnowBe4.com.

Topics

On the Topics page, you can view all of your learning topics organized by category.

When you click on a specific topic, you’ll be able to view all the courses for that topic. You can click Follow to receive notifications when new lessons are added to the topic.

Library

On the Library page, you can view all of your academy content.

Click on a specific activity to begin learning.

images.alt:
This image captures a segment of a web application dashboard, specifically focusing on a risk score visualization and contextual links.

**UI Header Elements (Top Bar):**
The persistent header displays navigation options: a "MORE" dropdown menu on the left. The current user is identified by the email address `qa@professorphisher.com`. Standard notification (bell icon) and help (question mark icon) buttons are located on the far right.

**Risk Score Visualization (Gauge):**
The primary content is a color-coded, semi-circular gauge displaying a risk score scale from 0 to 100. The scale is segmented into colored zones (Green, Yellow, Orange, Red) corresponding to increasing risk levels. Major tick marks are labeled at 0, 20, 40, 60, 80, and 100. The blue needle pointer currently indicates a score of **0**, which is also displayed numerically below the gauge's pivot point. An auxiliary grid/dashboard icon is located in the upper right corner of the content panel.

**Contextual Text and Links:**
Below the gauge, instructional text provides links to documentation:
1. "See our **Virtual Risk Officer (VRO) Guide** for details about how Risk Scores are calculated."
2. A highlighted link (preceded by the red text "NEW:"): "See our **Risk Score v2 Report.**"

This image displays a fragment of a technical application dashboard, divided into a dark-themed left navigation rail and a light-themed main content area.

**Left Navigation Rail (Sidebar):**
The rail utilizes a dark background and displays navigation links. Visible elements include:
*   The active menu text: **Blocklist**.
*   Two inactive outline icons: A gear icon (Settings/Configuration) and a standard user/profile icon.

**Main Content Area (Data Panels):**
This area displays multiple content cards containing data visualization fragments.

*   **Upper Panel:** Shows the axes of a truncated line chart. Labels include a y-axis coordinate of **-1** and an x-axis date of **Jan 1**.
*   **Lower Panel:** Displays a data panel titled **Reported Messages by Priority**. This panel includes a truncated graph legend identifying two priority categories:
    *   Unknown (represented by a light grey line).
    *   Low (represented by a darker grey line).
    *   A y-axis coordinate labeled **1** is present.

A standard pointer-style mouse cursor is visible near the boundary between the navigation rail and the main content area.

This image is a screenshot of a web or application user interface (UI) depicting a contextual dropdown menu, likely accessed via a profile icon in the top navigation bar.

**Contextual Navigation Bar Elements (Top Row):**
1.  A button labeled "Search" preceded by a magnifying glass icon.
2.  A button labeled "Topics" followed by a downward chevron icon.
3.  A generic user profile icon (triggering the active menu).

**Profile Dropdown Menu (Context Menu):**
The vertical dropdown menu extends from beneath the profile icon and includes the following structured elements:

*   **Header:** An unclickable area displaying a profile icon and a large, horizontally blurred/redacted area, typically reserved for user name or status.
*   **Menu Options (Top Section):**
    *   `My Profile` (preceded by a person icon).
    *   `Favorites` (preceded by a heart icon).
    *   `History` (preceded by a counter-clockwise arrow/refresh icon).
    *   `Settings` (preceded by a gear icon).
*   **Menu Options (Bottom Section):**
    *   Separated by a horizontal divider line.
    *   `Log Out` (preceded by an exit/door icon).

**Annotation:**
A large, solid orange arrow is overlaid on the image, pointing directly from the right edge of the menu toward the `Settings` text and its associated gear icon, emphasizing this menu selection.
images.context: -right corner of the page, then click Settings.

images.alt:
This image depicts the main "Home" page of the KnowBe4 Academy web interface, serving as a centralized portal for security training resources.

## UI Elements and Content

### Header and Navigation
*   **Branding:** Located top-left, displaying "knowbe4 | Academy."
*   **Primary Navigation:** Features links for "Home" (active), "Topics," and "Library."
*   **Utility Bar (Top Right):** Includes universal controls for "Search," a "Topics" dropdown menu, and a User Profile icon.

### Hero Banner and Call to Action (CTA)
*   **Headline:** "Welcome to the KnowBe4 Academy!"
*   **Subtext:** "A place to explore, practice, and grow."
*   **Primary CTA Button:** A prominent orange button labeled "Start learning" accompanied by a downward arrow icon.

### Course Listing Section (Card Modules)

The page presents training modules in a scrollable card format, featuring titles, descriptions, and metadata.

| Course Title | Context/Tag | Description Summary | Metadata |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Security Awareness Training** | NEW | Focuses on using KSAT for organizational security, including SSO, user management, and campaign customization. | 2.3h |
| **PhishER 101** | N/A | Training on identifying, responding to, and automating email threats using the PhishER console. | 2h Beginner |
| **Free Tools 101** | N/A | Introduces KnowBe4's free tool suite, specifically the Phish Alert Button (PAB) and the Automated Security Awareness Program (ASAP). | 20m Beginner |
| **KnowBe4 101** | N/A | Overview of KnowBe4 products, services, and mission to reinforce user security behaviors. | 45m Beginner |

### Resource Links Section

The footer area contains modules linking to support and external resources, each featuring an external link icon next to the title.

1.  **Knowledge Base:** Links to articles and videos for technical support.
2.  **Explore the Community:** Links to a customer forum for knowledge sharing and feature requests.
3.  **Visit KnowBe4.com:** Links to the primary company website for product and resource information.

This image captures a web interface for a learning management system (LMS), specifically the **KnowBe4 Academy**.

**Header and Navigation:**
The top navigation bar features the "knowbe4" logo. The primary navigation links include "Academy," "Home," "Topics," and "Library." The "Topics" link is currently active, indicated by an orange underline. The utility bar on the right contains a "Search" button (with a magnifying glass icon), a "Topics" dropdown menu, and a profile icon (generic user silhouette).

**Main Content Area:**
The primary page header is **"Onboarding."**

Immediately below the header is a single content tile (module card) representing a course or category. This tile features:
1.  **Illustration:** A graphic depicting a study area, including a stack of books (with bookmarks), reading glasses, a pencil, a framed certificate/award, and a potted plant.
2.  **Text Label:** **"Onboarding."** (This text functions as the title for the specific module presented in the tile.)
images.context: n view all of your learning topics organized by category.

images.alt:
This screenshot displays the **Onboarding** topic page within the **KnowBe4 Academy** application interface.

**UI Structure and Navigation:**

1.  **Global Navigation:** The top bar includes the brand logo (`knowbe4`) and primary tabs: `Academy`, `Home`, `Topics`, and `Library`. The `Library` tab is active, indicated by an orange underline.
2.  **Utility Navigation:** The top right features utility icons for `Search`, a `Topics` dropdown menu, and a user profile icon.
3.  **Page Header:** The main content title is **Onboarding**.
    *   A primary action button, **+ Follow** (styled in red), is located in the upper right of the content area.
    *   A dedicated search bar labeled **Search Topic** is centered below the main title.

**Content Layout (Topic Listing):**

The page displays a structured, vertical list of training modules, each presented as a distinct card with text aligned left and a visual thumbnail aligned right.

**Detailed Module Data:**

1.  **Security Awareness Training:**
    *   **Title:** Security Awareness Training.
    *   **Description Context:** Focuses on strengthening security posture using **KSAT**, including implementation details (SSO, whitelisting, phishing campaigns, and custom **Learner Experience (LX)**).
    *   **Metadata:** A duration indicator showing **2.3h**.
    *   **Thumbnail:** A dark, patterned graphic featuring the KnowBe4 icon and a label reading "Security Awareness Training."

2.  **PhishER 101:**
    *   **Title:** PhishER 101.
    *   **Description Context:** Covers identifying, reporting, and responding to email threats, and fundamental use of the **KnowBe4’s PhishER console**.
    *   **Metadata:** A duration of **2h** and the difficulty level **Beginner**.
    *   **Thumbnail:** Features a red 'R' icon and a label reading "PhishER 101."

3.  **Free Tools 101:**
    *   **Title:** Free Tools 101.
    *   **Description Context:** Introduces KnowBe4's free tool offerings, specifically mentioning the **Phish Alert Button (PAB)** and the **Automated Security Awareness Program (ASAP)**.
    *   **Metadata:** A duration of **20m** and the difficulty level **Beginner**.
    *   **Thumbnail:** Features a red crossed wrench/screwdriver icon and a label reading "Free Tools 101." (Note: The module description is truncated at the bottom of the viewport.)
images.context: notifications when new lessons are added to the topic.

images.alt:
This image displays the "All Activities" page within the KnowBe4 Academy platform interface.

**1. Header Navigation:**
The top global navigation bar includes the "knowb4 Academy" logo/branding and standard tabs: "Home," "Topics," and "Library." The **Library** tab is currently active, indicated by an orange underline. On the right, utility links include a "Search" button, a "Topics" dropdown selector, and a user profile icon.

**2. Main Content Area:**
The main content is titled **"All Activities."** Directly below the title is a filter control: a search bar labeled **"Search Topic"** with an embedded magnifying glass icon.

**3. Activity List (Content Display):**
The primary section lists available learning modules. Three entries are visible, following an identical structure:

*   **Title (H3 equivalent):** e.g., "Localization."
*   **Description:** A short paragraph explaining the module's content.
*   **Metadata:** Duration and difficulty, displayed as **"10m Beginner."**
*   **Graphic:** A standardized thumbnail featuring a lined document, a red pencil, and a circular red learning badge icon.

**Visible Activity Modules:**
1.  **Localization:** Focuses on managing language settings for global phishing campaigns.
2.  **Learner Experience Setup:** Focuses on managing the Learner Experience (LX) and navigating the Learner and Team Dashboards.
3.  **Using Reports:** Focuses on generating reports within the SAT Reports tab to monitor performance.
